alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Summers; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 5:54PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Greenbrier and northeastern Summers Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 550 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rupert. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds up to 30 mph. Heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain may wash debris onto the highway with poor drainage flooding along driveways and culvert pipes. Locations impacted include... Rupert... Lawn... Elton... Meadow Bluff... Anjean... and Meadow Bridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain is the main threat with the potential to reduce visibility, and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning...especially along Highway 60 between Rupert and where it intersects with Interstate 64.
